p: Lupeol ( Fig. 1B) interacted with HBV Pol by forming four alkyl hydrophobic interactions with Pro5, Leu42 and Arg120, and six Pi-alkyl hydrophobic interactions with Trp3, His156 and Tyr158 ( Fig. 7B). Other residues that surrounded lupeol were Glu1, Asp2, Ser40, Ser117, Asn118, Ser119 and Leu157. The Gibb's free energy of lupeol-Pol interaction was predicted to be −8.1 kcal/mol which corresponded to a binding constant of 8.7 × 10 5/mol ( Table 2).
